edu.uw.cirg.truenth.oauth

Class TrueNTHOAuthService

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uw.cirg.truenth.oauth.TrueNTHOAuthService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.scribe.oauth.OAuthService

    public class TrueNTHOAuthService
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.scribe.oauth.OAuthService
    OAuth service.

    This class produces the main artifacts to issue requests towards SS, providing instances that centralize all configuration and addressing elements to access SS' OAuth APIs. Each SS instance will have its own client side counterpart represented by an instance of this class.

    Services:

    • Obtain access tokens;
    • Obtain updated access tokens;
    • Create authorization URLs;
    • Access configured SS' URLs;
    • Issue requests;
    • Sign requests.

    SS' API specification: https://stg.us.truenth.org/dist/

    Since:
    Sep 11, 2015
    Author:
    Victor de Lima Soares

      • isAccessTokenActive

        public boolean isAccessTokenActive(org.scribe.model.Token accessToken)
        Checks if the access token is active in the SS instance.
        Parameters:
        accessToken - Token that will be verified.
        Returns:
        • True, if the token is still valid;
        • False, if the token is invalid or expired;
        • False, if the verification is not possible.

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl()
        Returns the redirection URL where users authenticate.

        This URL will be used to redirect users to SS, which will authenticate them and redirect them back to the local callback URL.

        This URL will point to the SS' Authorization address. In that location, users will be authenticated to receive an Authorization Code.

        With the Authorization Code, the users will be redirected back to the callback URL, where the local system receives the Authorization code to be exchanged for an Access Token.

        Returns:
        The URL where users should be redirected.
        See Also:
        TrueNTHOAuthProvider.getAuthorizationUrl(TrueNTHOAuthConfig)

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(int numberEncodings,
                                            org.scribe.model.ParameterList callbackParameters)
        Returns the URL where users authenticate and authorize clients.

        This URL will be used to redirect users to SS, which will authenticate them and redirect them back to the local callback URL.

        This URL will point to the SS' Authorization address. In that location, users will be authenticated to receive an Authorization Code.

        With the Authorization Code, the users will be redirected back to the callback URL, where the local system receives the Authorization Code to be exchanged for an Access Token.

        This is just a convenience method. Same as: getAuthorizationUrl(numberEncodings, callbackParameters, null)

        Parameters:
        numberEncodings - Number of URL encoding operations to be applied on the callback URL. For instance, two encoding operations are necessary to communicate properly with SS after browser redirections in POP UPs.
        callbackParameters - Additional parameters to add into the callback URL. Those parameters are destined to the callback target.
        Returns:
        The URL where users will be redirected.
        See Also:
        getAuthorizationUrl(int, ParameterList, ParameterList)

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(int numberEncodings,
                                            org.scribe.model.ParameterList callbackParameters,
                                            org.scribe.model.ParameterList parameters)
        Returns the URL where users authenticate and authorize clients.

        This URL will be used to redirect users to SS, which will authenticate them and redirect them back to the local callback URL.

        This URL will point to the SS' Authorization address. In that location, users will be authenticated to receive an Authorization Code.

        With the Authorization Code, the users will be redirected back to the callback URL, where the local system receives the Authorization Code to be exchanged for an Access Token.

        Parameters:
        numberEncodings - Number of URL encoding operations to be applied on the callback URL. For instance, two encoding operations are necessary to communicate properly with SS after browser redirections in POP UPs.
        callbackParameters - Additional parameters to add into the callback URL. Those parameters are destined to the callback target.
        parameters - Additional parameters to add into the Authorization URL. This parameter list should be used for special circumstances to fine tune requests directed to the OAuth server; for instance SS's "next" parameter. Parameters coming form the OAuthConfig will be automatically appended (by the provider); such as "scope".
        Returns:
        The URL where users will be redirected.

      • getAuthorizationUrl

public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(org.scribe.model.Token requestToken)

        Returns:
        The URL where you should redirect your users.
        See Also:
        TrueNTHOAuthProvider.getAuthorizationUrl(TrueNTHOAuthConfig)

      • getBaseURL

        public java.lang.String getBaseURL()
        Returns the configured Shared Services' base URL.

        This URL points to Shared Services base URL, it should not be used for OAuth operation, but for fetching static resources, such as CSS. It is mainly used for templates and cases where the resource must come form the same SS instance.

        Returns:
        Configured Shared Services base URL.

        Returns:
        Nothing will be returned, and an exception will be thrown.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - This operation is not supported by SS; thus, this workflow shall not be used.

      • getResourceURL

        public java.lang.String getResourceURL()
        Returns the configured OAuth API base URL (API base).

        For instance: https://stg.us.truenth.org/api

        Returns:
        API base URL.

      • getRolesURL

        public java.lang.String getRolesURL()
        Returns the configured roles URL.

        This method returns the generic address of users' roles. It contains the #userId wildcard, and it does not represent a real location.

        For instance: https://stg.us.truenth.org/api/user/#userId/roles

        Returns:
        Roles URL.

      • getRolesURL

        public java.lang.String getRolesURL(long userId)
        Returns the configured roles URL, for a specific user.

        Replaces the userId place holder with the String representation of the TrueNTH User ID.

        Parameters:
        userId - TrueNTH User ID.
        Returns:
        Roles URL.

      • signRequest

        public void signRequest(org.scribe.model.Token accessToken,
                        org.scribe.model.OAuthRequest request)
        Signs a request.

        This method appends the access token into the request, according to the configured signature type.

        It supports the following two signature types:

        • SignatureType.Header;
        • SignatureType.QueryString;

        SignatureType.Header: Appends "BEARER" as an authentication header.

        SignatureType.QueryString: Append "oauth_token" as a query string parameter.

        Specified by:
        signRequest in interface org.scribe.oauth.OAuthService
